BiblioData.Title: IMPROVEMENTS RELATING TO ELECTRO- OPTIC WINDOWS
BiblioData.Abstract: An electro-optic window (1200) is made of a material substantially transparent to infra-red radiation and is treated to have reduced RF transmission characteristics by the provision of carbon nanotubes within the window or on at least one surface thereof.

Claims.P: CLAIMS

1. An electro-optic window made of a material substantially transparent to at least one of infra-red and visible radiation and treated to have reduced RF transmission characteristics by the provision of carbon nanotubes within the window or on at least one surface thereof.
2. An electro-optic window according to Claim 1 , wherein said carbon nanotubes are provided as a layer on one surface of the window.
3. An electro-optic window according to Claim 2, wherein said layer of carbon nanotubes has a mat structure.
4. An electro-optic window according to Claim 1 or Claim 2, wherein said layer includes an array of holes.

5. An electro-optic window according to Claim 4, wherein said holes are formed by laser drilling. 6. An electro-optic window according to Claim 1 , wherein said carbon nanotubes are incorporated into a film applied to a surface of said material transparent to infra-red and/or visible radiation, said film comprising a polymer material incorporating said carbon nanotubes.
7. An electro-optic window according to Claim 1 , wherein said carbon nanotubes are incorporated into the material transparent to infra-red and/or visible radiation during formation of the window.
8. An electro-optic window according to any of the preceding Claims, wherein said material transparent to infra-red and/or visible radiation comprises a crystalline material.
9. An electro-optic window according to any of Claims 1 to 8, wherein said material substantially transparent to radiation comprises a glass material.
10. A method of making an electro-optic window which comprises providing a distribution of carbon nanotubes within the window or on at least one surface thereof.
11. A method according to Claim 10, which includes a step of providing a mat made of carbon nanotubes, and bonding said mat to the surface of the window.
12. A method according to Claim 11 , wherein said mat is provided with an array of holes to increase the IR transmission characteristics thereof.
13. A method according to Claim 12, wherein said holes are formed by laser drilling.
14. A method according to Claim 10, wherein said distribution is provided by applying a dryable or curable liquid carrier containing a dispersion of carbon nanotubes.
15. A method according to Claim 14, wherein said liquid carrier is applied by spraying, optionally through a mask.

16. A method according to Claim 14, wherein said liquid carrier is applied to said window using a spin-on process. 17. A method according to Claim 10, which comprises providing a window precursor material in particulate form and dispersing carbon nanotubes within said window precursor material to form a composite material.
18. A method according to Claim 17, wherein said window precursor material particles are substantially mono-disperse.

19. A method according to Claim 18, which includes the step of providing said particulate window material in colloidal form and dispersing carbon nanotubes in said colloid, and thereafter drying said colloid.
20. A method according to Claim 19, which includes applying elevated pressure and temperature to said dried colloid to form said window.
21. A method according to Claim 10, which includes the step of dispersing said nanotubes in a resin or polymer and thereafter applying said polymer to the surface of a window material.
22. A method according to Claim 17, wherein said carbon nanotubes are initially coated with said window material.
23. A method according to Claim 10, which includes the step of depositing nanotubes onto an electro-optic window by chemical vapour deposition.
